cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 490 miles SE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northwest on Friday, then accelerating north-northeast toward southern New England over the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England coast (likely Rhode Island/Connecticut vicinity)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches in effect; interests from the Mid-Atlantic to Atlantic Canada advised to monitor.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East-coast waters from the Outer Banks of North Carolina northward through New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤ 7%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts Sunday into early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (1–2 ft) possible along Delaware Bay and lower Delaware River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate rain could bring 1–2 inches Sunday–Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher surf beginning this weekend.
